Wells Fargo is having a very difficult

continue on but Wells Fargo as we know

with inside the corporation changing

found out and they're just having a
whole lot of problems we see the US

here is that the service has collapsed
to the lowest since March of 2017 and
the composite index slipped to its
weakest since April 2017 and this does
not look good whatsoever because we can
see right now things are starting to
fall apart if we go back to 2006-2007
leading into 2008 we had a steady
decline of the composite PMI and US GDP
as it declined right down into the
negative territory and it looks like
we're heading in this area once again
dipped way down during the election time
in 2016 and then of course what happened
was Trump came in the economy was
boosted up for a while he started
manipulating all the numbers just like
Obama was doing but took it to the nth

because what happens is you can

you can make people feel good you can

the people behind him know this they're

this economy and using the weapons of

they can't say anything against what

month this is the largest wave of

week through September 9th
there was 774 homes in manhattan
brooklyn and queens that got a price cut
the most for any seven-day period and
data going back to 2006 according to

easy the previous weekly record was in

reduced so we can see that we are doing

year sales of luxury apartments those

months of this year
forcing sellers to slash their prices I
wonder if that's why notion is selling
his
luxury apartment in New York getting

there's been a shift in GDP by like a

and I think they were depending on the

while this is technically what the Fed

no Fed or any other central bank for

already globally numerous markets
